title: (x) Stateless record cover very bold sans - custom by Non-Format {Rainer}
content:
Can anyone identify this font used by Non-Format in their work for Stateless?  
I've extracted the letter shapes from the original work to make it a bit easier \>

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075542im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TYPE_5186.jpg)

Or check out the covers themselves here \>  
 [http://www.non-format.com/files/254.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075542/http:/www.non-format.com/files/254.html "http://www.non-format.com/files/254.html")  
 [http://www.non-format.com/files/232.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075542/http:/www.non-format.com/files/232.html "http://www.non-format.com/files/232.html")
author: naoiseo

comments.content: Non-Format custom fonts are a regular topic here. Take a seat, take your time and read [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075542/http:/www.typophile.com/node/29460), [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075542/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31082) and [the listmasters finest assorted substitutes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150413075542/http:/typophile.com/node/37553).
